meanings.definition: A large corporation made up of different companies
meanings.sent1: The conglomerate owned various businesses, from tech companies to food chains.
meanings.sent2: The conglomerate's expansion led to it becoming a major player in the market.
meanings.sent3: The conglomerate of superheroes joined forces to save the city from disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a conglomerate of ideas, each one vying for attention.
meanings.sent5: The conglomerate of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: To gather or cluster together in a mass or whole
meanings.sent1: She decided to conglomerate all her clothes into one big pile for laundry.
meanings.sent2: The clouds began to conglomerate in the sky, signaling an incoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The kids' toys seemed to conglomerate in every corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts started to conglomerate into a plan for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: The ingredients slowly conglomerate into a delicious stew on the stove.
